item.title: Digital.Grinnell's IMI Workflow
item.description:
Note: The abbreviation IMI is used frequently in this post to represent the Islandora Multi-Importer, a CSV-file-driven batch ingest tool used by numerous institutions in the Islandora community.

Also, while updating this post I found this gem… Diagrams in Documentation (Markdown Guide).

This post is an addition to the discussion in post 028, Mounting //Storage for IMI Ingest in Digital.Grinnell which was written largely to remind me how the //Storage mount works. 😕 Unlike post 028, this post is meant for myself AND for others at Grinnell College who prepare digital objects for ingest via IMI. For those individuals… it’s not necessary that you understand all of this, but it you choose to read-on, I hope you find this information helpful.
